german short row short row enable you to add length to just a section of your work by turning the work before you reach the end of the row i find this method to be easier than the wrap and turn method and much less fussy this method will create a beautiful invisible sloping edge which we use here to add length to the center of the back to provide a better drape for the sweater here is a good video demonstrating this method https //www youtube com/watch v=i_6pjl20zka kitchener stitch a method for joining two row of live sts see the following video for a tutorial https //youtu be/-nlwkvrgp-4 provisional cast-on this method keeps live sts at the co edge which are kept from unraveling by some length of waste yarn these stitches are picked up later and worked in the other direction here is the method i recommend https //www youtube com/watch v=dxp8runxjty these simple socks can be worked using one of three methods for shaping the heel i provide instructions for the classic heel flap the short row heel or the afterthought heel regardless of the heel method you choose the leg the foot and the toe decreases will be identical so the only differing instructions are for the heel the socks are worked entirely in stockinette stitch if you choose to work the permanently folded cuff your socks will be firmer at the cuff and this will prevent them from sliding down your leg as easily to achieve the permanently folded cuff we use a provisional cast-on to give us live stitches at the cast on edge and later we pick up these stitches and work them together with the live stitches on the needles at the end of the cuff ribbing the legs are worked slightly longer than usual so they can be worn with winter boots comfortably you can choose your favorite heel method each is described below to achieve the fit you want directions using size us 1 needles cast on 56 64 72 sts using the provisional cast-on method setup row worked flat *k1 p1* across note if you d prefer not to work the permanently folded cuff join to work in the round and continue working 1x1 rib until your cuff measures about work your preferred cast on 4 25 /10 75 cm or about twice the desired cuff length about 40 row such as tubular or long-tail cast-on and work the cuff to next we will join the live sts from the cast on edge to the live sts on the needles creating your preferred length you may skip steps 1-3
